dashboard.description: VMware vSphere Dashboard using the new Telegraf plugin

targets.query: select count(count) AS VMs from (select count(usage_average) from vsphere_vm_cpu group by esxhostname) where $timeFilter group by time($__interval)

panels.description:
### Usage (MHz) Avg
CPU use in megahertz.


### Demand (MHz) Avg
CPU Demand
panels.title: CPU utilization/demand

panels.description:
### Data Receive Rate (KBps)
Data received rate in kilobytes per second.

### Data Transmit Rate (KBps)
Data transmission rate in kilobytes per second.


### Demand (MHz) Avg
CPU Demand
panels.title: VMnic traffic

panels.description:
### Received Packets Dropped
Number of received packages that were dropped.

### Transmitted Packets Dropped
Number of transmitted packets that were dropped.

-  the VMs aren’t processing the incoming packets fast enough and the queue got too long

-  there is a problem with the physical network hardware

- the network is overloaded
panels.title: VMnic dropped packets

panels.description:
### Read Latency (ms)
Read latency in milliseconds.

### Write Latency (ms)
Write latency in milliseconds.
panels.title: Datastore Latency

panels.description:
### vMotions
Number of vMotions.

### XvMotions
Numbers of XvMotion. XvMotion is a vSphere feature that provides the ability to migrate virtual machines files across hosts or clusters over the network without the need of shared storage.

### SvMotions
Number of VMware's Storage VMotions
panels.title: Number of vMotions

list.label: vCenter Server
list.name: vcenter
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM vsphere_cluster_mem WITH KEY=vcenter

list.label: Cluster
list.name: clustername
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM vsphere_host_cpu WITH KEY=clustername WHERE vcenter =~ /$vcenter/

list.label: ESXi Server
list.name: esxi
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM vsphere_host_cpu WITH KEY=esxhostname WHERE clustername =~ /$clustername/

list.label: Datastore
list.name: datastore
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM vsphere_datastore_disk WITH KEY=source WHERE vcenter =~ /$vcenter/

list.label: VM
list.name: virtualmachine
list.query: SHOW TAG VALUES FROM vsphere_vm_cpu WITH KEY=vmname WHERE vcenter =~ /$vcenter/ AND clustername =~ /$clustername/

dashboard.title: VMware vSphere  - Host Cluster Performance 2
